H0.text: A light bulb that is turned on best illustrates kinetic energy.

H1.text: A car that is parked on top of a hill is the example that best illustrates kinetic energy.

H2.text: A comet that is flying through space is the example that best illustrates kinetic energy.

H3.text: A battery that is connected to a circuit is the example that best illustrates kinetic energy.

A4.text: In physics, the kinetic energy of an object is the form of energy that it possesses due to its motion.

A5.text: The kinetic energy of an object is equal to the work, or force (F) in the direction of motion times its displacement (s), needed to accelerate the object from rest to its given speed.
